page.title: 03HISTORY OF GRANTOWN ON SPEY
page.content:
HISTORICAL GROWTH OF GRANTOWN ON SPEY
Grantown-on-Spey is recognised as one of the best examples of a planned town in the Highlands of Scotland. The age of Grantown can be accurately dated to 1766 when Sir Ludovic Grant offered lots of land for development.
Settlement within the area dates back to much arelier times, but was mainly concentrated around Castle Grant, about one mile north east of the present town.
The town grew as a centre for linen manufacture and as a market town. Although the linen industry collapsed, its market function has continued. In the late nineteenth century it grew as a tourist centre, especially after the visit of Queen Victoria in 1860.
